verses.text: In the third month , when the children of Israel were gone forth out of the land of Egypt , the same day came they \add into\add* the wilderness of Sinai.
For they were departed from Rephidim , and were come \add to\add* the desert of Sinai , and had pitched in the wilderness ; and there Israel camped before the mount.
And Moses went up unto God , and the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* called unto him out of the mountain , saying , Thus shalt thou say to the house of Jacob , and tell the children of Israel ;
Ye have seen what I did unto the Egyptians , and \add how\add* I bare you on eagles’ wings , and brought you unto myself.
Now therefore, if ye will obey my voice indeed , and keep my covenant , then ye shall be a peculiar treasure unto me above all people : for all the earth \add is\add* mine:
And ye shall be unto me a kingdom of priests , and an holy nation. These \add are\add* the words which thou shalt speak unto the children of Israel. \p
¶ And Moses came and called for the elders of the people , and laid before their faces all these words which the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* commanded him.

And all the people answered together , and said , All that the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* hath spoken we will do. And Moses returned the words of the people unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*. \p

And the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* said unto Moses , Lo, I come unto thee in a thick cloud , that the people may hear when I speak with thee, and believe thee for ever. And Moses told the words of the people unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*. \p
¶ And the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* said unto Moses , Go unto the people , and sanctify them to day and to morrow , and let them wash their clothes ,
And be ready against the third day : for the third day the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* will come down in the sight of all the people upon mount Sinai.

And thou shalt set bounds unto the people round about , saying , Take heed to yourselves, \add that ye\add* go \add not\add* up into the mount , or touch the border of it: whosoever toucheth the mount shall be surely put to death :

There shall not an hand touch it, but he shall surely be stoned , or shot through ; whether \add it be\add* beast or man , it shall not live : when the trumpet soundeth long , they shall come up to the mount.\f + \fr 19.13 \ft trumpet: or, cornet\f* \p
¶ And Moses went down from the mount unto the people , and sanctified the people ; and they washed their clothes.
And he said unto the people , Be ready against the third day : come not at \add your\add* wives. \p

¶ And it came to pass on the third day in the morning , that there were thunders and lightnings , and a thick cloud upon the mount , and the voice of the trumpet exceeding loud ; so that all the people that \add was\add* in the camp trembled.
And Moses brought forth the people out of the camp to meet with God ; and they stood at the nether part of the mount.

And mount Sinai was altogether on a smoke , because the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* descended upon it in fire : and the smoke thereof ascended as the smoke of a furnace , and the whole mount quaked greatly.
And when the voice of the trumpet sounded long , and waxed louder and louder , Moses spake , and God answered him by a voice.

And the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* came down upon mount Sinai , on the top of the mount : and the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* called Moses \add up\add* to the top of the mount ; and Moses went up.

And the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* said unto Moses , Go down , charge the people , lest they break through unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* to gaze , and many of them perish.  +  r 19.21  t charge: Heb. contest *

And let the priests also, which come near to the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, sanctify themselves, lest the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* break forth upon them.
And Moses said unto the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd*, The people cannot come up to mount Sinai : for thou chargedst us, saying , Set bounds about the mount , and sanctify it.

And the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* said unto him, Away , get thee down , and thou shalt come up , thou, and Aaron with thee: but let not the priests and the people break through to come up unto the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d*, lest he break forth upon them.
So Moses went down unto the people , and spake unto them.
